surah_info.description:
Name
"Nuh" is the name of this Surah as well as the title of its subject matter, for in it, from beginning to the end, the story of the Prophet Noah has been related.
Period of Revelation
This also is one of the earliest Surahs to be revealed at Makkah, but the internal evidence of its subject matter shows that it was sent down in the period when opposition to the Holy Prophet's message of Islam by the disbelievers of Makkah had grown very strong and active.
Theme and Subject
In this surah the story of the Prophet Noah has not been related only for the sake of story telling, but its object is to warn the disbelievers of Makkah, so as to say:"You, O people of Makkah, are adopting towards Muhammad (upon whom be Allah's peace and blessings) the same attitude as the people of the Prophet Noah had adopted towards him; if you do not change this attitude, you too would meet with the same end." This had not been said in so many words anywhere in the Surah, but in the background of the conditions under which this story was narrated to the people of Makkah, this subject itself became obvious.
vv. 2-4 briefly explain how he began his mission and what he preached.
Then after suffering hardships and troubles in the way of preaching his mission for ages the report that he made to his Lord has been given in vv. 5-20. In it he states how he had been trying to bring his people to the right path and how his people had stubbornly opposed him.
After this, the Prophet Noah's final submission has been recorded in vv. 21-24, in which he prays to his Lord, saying: "These people have rejected my invitation: they are blindly following their chiefs, who have devised a tremendous plot of deceit and cunning. Time now has come when these people should be deprived of every grace to accept guidance." This was not an expression of impatience by the Prophet Noah, but when after having preached his message under extremely trying circumstances for centuries be became utterly disappointed with his people, he formed the opinion that no chance whatever was left of their coming to the right path. His this opinion fully conformed to Allah's own decision. Thus, in the next verse (25), it has been said: "The torment of Allah descended on those people because of their misdeeds."
In the concluding verse, the Prophet Noah's supplication that he made to his Lord, right at the time the torment descended, has been recorded. In it he prays for his own and for all the believers' forgiveness, and makes a submission to Allah to the effect: "Do not leave any of the disbelievers alive on the earth, for they have become utterly devoid of every good: they will not beget any but disbelieving and wicked descendants."
While studying this Surah one should keep in view the details of the Prophet Noah's story which have been given in the Qur'an above. For this see Al-Araf: 59-64, Yunus: 71-73, Hud: 25-49, Al-Mu'minun: 23-31, Ash- Shua'ra: 105-122, Al-Ankabut: 14-15, As-Saaffat: 75-82, Al-Qamar: 9-16.

surah_verses.arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦٓ أَنْ أَنذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
surah_verses.en_text: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people ˹saying to him˺, “Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنِّى لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
surah_verses.en_text: Noah proclaimed, “O my people! I am truly sent to you with a clear warning:

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
surah_verses.en_text: worship Allah ˹alone˺, fear Him, and obey me.

surah_verses.arabic_text: يَغْفِرْ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَوْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: He will forgive your sins, and delay your end until the appointed time.<sup foot_note=77552>1</sup> Indeed, when the time set by Allah comes, it cannot be delayed, if only you knew!”

surah_verses.arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِى لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا
surah_verses.en_text: He cried, “My Lord! I have surely called my people day and night,

surah_verses.arabic_text: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَآءِىٓ إِلَّا فِرَارًا
surah_verses.en_text: but my calls only made them run farther away.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَإِنِّى كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوٓا۟ أَصَـٰبِعَهُمْ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَٱسْتَغْشَوْا۟ ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا۟ وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ ٱسْتِكْبَارًا
surah_verses.en_text: And whenever I invite them to be forgiven by You, they press their fingers into their ears, cover themselves with their clothes, persist ˹in denial˺, and act very arrogantly.

surah_verses.arabic_text: يُرْسِلِ ٱلسَّمَآءَ عَلَيْكُم مِّدْرَارًا
surah_verses.en_text: He will shower you with abundant rain,

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَيُمْدِدْكُم بِأَمْوَٰلٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ جَنَّـٰتٍ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ أَنْهَـٰرًا
surah_verses.en_text: supply you with wealth and children, and give you gardens as well as rivers.

surah_verses.arabic_text: مَّا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا
surah_verses.en_text: What is the matter with you that you are not in awe of the Majesty of Allah,

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا
surah_verses.en_text: when He truly created you in stages ˹of development˺?<sup foot_note=77553>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا۟ كَيْفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَـٰوَٰتٍ طِبَاقًا
surah_verses.en_text: Do you not see how Allah created seven heavens, one above the other,

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَجَعَلَ ٱلْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا
surah_verses.en_text: placing the moon within them as a ˹reflected˺ light, and the sun as a ˹radiant˺ lamp?

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا
surah_verses.en_text: Allah ˹alone˺ caused you<sup foot_note=77554>1</sup> to grow from the earth like a plant.

surah_verses.arabic_text: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا
surah_verses.en_text: Then He will return you to it, and then simply bring you forth ˹again˺.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا
surah_verses.en_text: And Allah ˹alone˺ spread out the earth for you

surah_verses.arabic_text: لِّتَسْلُكُوا۟ مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا
surah_verses.en_text: to walk along its spacious pathways.’”

surah_verses.arabic_text: قَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِى وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ مَن لَّمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارًا
surah_verses.en_text: ˹Eventually,˺ Noah cried, “My Lord! They have certainly persisted in disobeying me, and followed ˹instead˺ those ˹elite˺ whose ˹abundant˺ wealth and children only increase them in loss,

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا
surah_verses.en_text: and who have devised a tremendous plot,

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَقَالُوا۟ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا
surah_verses.en_text: urging ˹their followers˺, ‘Do not abandon your idols—especially Wadd, Suwâ’, Yaghûth, Ya’ûq, and Nasr.’<sup foot_note=77555>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا۟ كَثِيرًا ۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَـٰلًا
surah_verses.en_text: Those ˹elite˺ have already led many astray. So ˹O Lord˺, only allow the wrongdoers to stray farther away.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٔـٰتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا۟ فَأُدْخِلُوا۟ نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارًا
surah_verses.en_text: So because of their sins, they were drowned, then admitted into the Fire. And they found none to help them against Allah.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
surah_verses.en_text: Noah had prayed, “My Lord! Do not leave a single disbeliever on earth.

surah_verses.arabic_text: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا۟ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا
surah_verses.en_text: For if You spare ˹any of˺ them, they will certainly mislead Your servants, and give birth only to ˹wicked˺ sinners, staunch disbelievers.

surah_verses.arabic_text: رَّبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَىَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِىَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًۢا
surah_verses.en_text: My Lord! Forgive me, my parents, and whoever enters my house in faith, and ˹all˺ believing men and women. And increase the wrongdoers only in destruction.”
